author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> the last open cryptography PR #3093 just got merged.

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> next steps on the cryptography side is probably to discuss whether we want to introduce functions to do batch verificaton on the spec, for use during sync

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> i can see the value in standarizing how the batched verification works, instead of having ad-hoc impementations in clients.

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> both in terms of guiding the client devs, and also eventually introducing test vectors etc.

author: bridge-bot
content: <sauliusgr> by batched verification you mean batching multiple blobs?

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> probably batching the verification of multiple blocks

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> wrt blobs of course

author: bridge-bot
content: <sauliusgr> at least from our experience with optimising syncing at Grandine (we have very fast sync) there are various subtle things when sqeezing for performance. Sometimes it's actually faster to very two things in parallel comparing to cryptographic batching algo that takes less cpu cycles but actually is slower in time on single/less threads. So this is very case-by-case, especially when some surrounding details raises like limitation of what can be batched together.

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> good point

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> i think before we commit to introducing yet another crypto functionality as part of the spec, we should get some more precise benchmarks/figures on how blob verification is bottlenecking sync

author: bridge-bot
